docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The end of a Federal aid program that provided more than half the money for some municipal budgets has caused a severe financial crisis in small and medium-size cities around the country and is forcing larger cities to make hard choices between cutting services and raising taxes.

headline.main: END OF FEDERAL REVENUE SHARING CREATING FINANCIAL CRISES IN MANY CITIES
